publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4743 Ms Maureen Watt: International Suicide Prevention Awareness Week—That the Parliament notes with concern that Scotland has the highest rate of suicide in the United Kingdom and congratulates the organisations and individuals taking part in activities during International Suicide Prevention Awareness Week, which runs from 4 to 10 September 2006, for attempting to tackle this taboo subject.

S2M-4743 International Suicide Prevention Awareness Week (lodged on 4 September 2006) Michael Matheson*, Donald Gorrie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Jim Mather*, Carolyn Leckie*, David McLetchie*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Christine Grahame*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Rosie Kane*, Dave Petrie*, Ms Sandra White*, Brian Adam*, Derek Brownlee*, Tommy Sheridan*, Bruce Crawford*
S2M-4743 International Suicide Prevention Awareness Week (lodged on 4 September 2006) Patrick Harvie*, Robin Harper*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Adam Ingram*

S2M-4743 Ms Maureen Watt: International Suicide Prevention Awareness Week—That the Parliament notes with concern that Scotland has the highest rate of suicide in the United Kingdom and congratulates the organisations and individuals taking part in activities during International Suicide Prevention Awareness Week, which runs from 4 to 10 September 2006, for attempting to tackle this taboo subject. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Donald Gorrie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Jim Mather, Carolyn Leckie, David McLetchie, Mr Jim Wallace, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Christine Grahame, Mrs Nanette Milne, Rosie Kane, Dave Petrie, Ms Sandra White, Brian Adam, Derek Brownlee, Tommy Sheridan, Bruce Crawford, Patrick Harvie, Robin Harper, Roseanna Cunningham, Eleanor Scott, Mr Adam Ingram, Frances Curran*, Mr David Davidson*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-4743 International Suicide Prevention Awareness Week (lodged on 4 September 2006) Pauline McNeill*
S2M-4743 International Suicide Prevention Awareness Week (lodged on 4 September 2006) Fiona Hyslop*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-4743 International Suicide Prevention Awareness Week (lodged on 4 September 2006) Cathy Peattie*
